question.body: Based on the graph that you produced for answering the previous question, summarize what the data suggest about how CFF is related to eye color. Do you think that the data provide enough evidence against the null hypothesis? (There is no right or wrong answer here, just your feelings from looking at the data.)

part.explanation: The data suggest that the CFF of the people with brown eyes is the lowest (on average), followed by green-eyed people, and people with blue eyes have the highest CFF (on average). It seems like that there is a reasonable amount of evidence in the data against Ho. The three boxplots do not overlap much, and it really doesn't seem very likely that the three populations from which these three samples were chosen all share the same mean.
